seriesJson.title: China: Policy and perspective
seriesJson.description: A series of talks from the University of Chicago dealing with current events in China.

node.title: China, U.S. and the Soviet Union
node.description: This program features a lecture by  Donald Zagoria of Columbia University.

node.title: China's nuclear capability
node.description: This program features a lecture by Albert Wohlstetter of the University of Chicago.

node.title: China's military capability
node.description: This program features a lecture by Frank Armbruster of the Hudson Institute.

node.title: China's foreign policy, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, features a lecture on Chinese foreign policy by David Mozingo of Cornell University.

node.title: China's foreign policy, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features a lecture on Chinese foreign policy by David Mozingo of Cornell University.

node.title: Leadership crisis in China
node.description: This program features a lecture by John Wilson Lewis, an expert on Chinese politics.

node.title: Cultural Revolution
node.description: This program features a lecture by Tang Tsou of the University of Chicago.

node.title: Salient aspects of China's history
node.description: This program features a lecture by Chinese-American historian Ping-ti Ho of the University of Chicago.
